abstract: Before he is sentenced on Monday, Bernard L. Madoff and his wife Ruth have struck a deal with the prosecutors to allow federal marshals to sell his assets including his homes, cars and yachts.
snippet: Before he is sentenced on Monday, Bernard L. Madoff and his wife Ruth have struck a deal with the prosecutors to allow federal marshals to sell his assets including his homes, cars and yachts.
lead_paragraph: Update | 4:17 p.m. Before he is sentenced to a possible life term on Monday, Bernard L. Madoff and his wife Ruth have struck a deal with the prosecutors to allow federal marshals to sell his assets including his homes, cars, yachts and jewelry. The deal also allows Mrs. Madoff to keep $2.5 million in cash.

headline.main: Madoffs Turn Over Assets, Ruth Keeps $2.5 Million
